docs.lead_paragraph: THE BRITISH COMMANDERS--His Royal Highness the Duke of Cambridge. DICK TINTO ON HIS TRAVELS--A View of Florence. SPANISH AFFAIRS--No Union of Spain and Portugal. LETTER FROM CHILI--Railroads and Explorations. LATER FROM EUROPE--Inefficiency of the Army in the Crimes.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Trial by July--A Lecture, by Hon John P. Hale. The Alleged Slaver Case. The Mayor Asks for Help.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Thursday evening, at the Broadway Tabernacle Hon. JOHN P. HALE delivered the second of the course of Lectures before the New-England Young Men's Association. There was a good attendance. The subject announced for the evening was "Trial by Jury." "
docs.snippet: On Thursday evening, at the Broadway Tabernacle Hon. JOHN P. HALE delivered the second of the course of Lectures before the New-England Young Men's Association. There was a good attendance. The subject announced for the evening was "Trial by Jury." "

headline.main: ONE WEEK LATER FROM EUROPE,; ARRIVAL OF THE PACIFIC. THE CZAR ACCEPTS THE FOUR CONDITIONS. HOSTILITIES CONTINUE. THE PRINCIPALITIES AGAIN INVADED. Capture of Tukscha and Babadagh by the Russians. OPERATIONS BEFORE SEBASTOPOL. ANOTHER SORTIE OF THE GARRISON. THE RUSSIANS REPULSED. SARDINIA JOINS THE ALLIANOE. Loss of Ship George Canning. Cotton Improved---Breadstuffs Down---Consols 91 7-8.ols 91 7-8.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail steamer Pacific, from Liverpool, afternoon of Saturday the 13th instant, with 62 passengers, arrived at this port yesterday at 9 A. M. The Pacific arrived out 9 1/2 o'clock P. M. of Tuesday the 9th.
docs.snippet: The U. S. Mail steamer Pacific, from Liverpool, afternoon of Saturday the 13th instant, with 62 passengers, arrived at this port yesterday at 9 A. M. The Pacific arrived out 9 1/2 o'clock P. M. of Tuesday the 9th.

docs.lead_paragraph: FATHER MATHEW.-By letters received in this city to the date of 24th December, from Madeira, we learn that the health of Father MATHEW had very much improved since his arrival at that Island.
docs.snippet: FATHER MATHEW.-By letters received in this city to the date of 24th December, from Madeira, we learn that the health of Father MATHEW had very much improved since his arrival at that Island.

headline.main: The Senate Bill to Protect Life and Health on Passenger Ships.

docs.lead_paragraph: "Mortality at Sea,"-" Cholera on Shipboard,"-" The Wrongs of Emigrants on board Passenger Ships,"--these are collocations of words with which the papers are filled every Fall, and which philanthropic men are often found repeating. How to be rid of

headline.main: Health of Mr. Mason, United States Minister to Paris.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following note, (says the Richmond Enquirer,) conveys the only reliable information of the condition of Judge MASON which has been received in this country: RICHMOND, Monday, Jan. 22, 1855. MESSRS. EDITORS: Will you do me the favor to publish the subjoined extract of a letter received this morning from Dr. BIGELOW, of Paris, the family physician of our friend, Judge MASON?

docs.lead_paragraph: STARVED TO DEATH.--The Geneva Gazette mentions the death of a Mr. JOHN ROBSON of that town, and adds as the cause of his disease that it was a stoppage between the stomach and bowels, that rendered futile any effort to retain nourishment or medicine.
docs.snippet: STARVED TO DEATH.--The Geneva Gazette mentions the death of a Mr. JOHN ROBSON of that town, and adds as the cause of his disease that it was a stoppage between the stomach and bowels, that rendered futile any effort to retain nourishment or medicine.

docs.lead_paragraph: In these days of degeneracy, it does one good to see the giant blows that Dr. WILLIAM A. ALCOTT, of Auburndale, Mass., inflicts upon the great enemy of the human race. and especially of children-salaratus.

headline.main: STATE AFFAIRS.; MEMBERS ALL GOING TO THE POOR-HOUSE. PROSPECT OF A GLORIOUS FUDDLE. Adoption of the Resolution Disbanding our Foreign Legions. BANK REPORTS. WHAT THE LEGISLATURE IS GOING TO DO. BREAKING UP OF OUR QUARANTINE,

docs.lead_paragraph: Legislation goes on slowly--little accomplished, much talked of, and the State prospers by the procrastination. Let us be thankful. NOTICES OF WHAT IS COMING. But we had an active notification this morning of work to be presented, out of which 1 pick one or two that particularly interest the City of New-York.
